page.title: 12SANDS COURT
page.content:
SANDS COURT.This is a large grey stone house built in the C18th as a dower house for the Codrington family.Stone lions guard the entrance to the house.In the front living room is a small narrow window, called a squint. From here one can see a wall in the garden which divides the garden into two lawns.In the wall is another window through which one can see straight through to the second lawn and to the greenhouse, this device was used by a suspicious owner of the past to see what his gardener was doing!
The house has its own electric generator for use in emergency, particularly in Winter when it is often snowed in.
